answer:
<p>In computer science terms, we talk about anonymous functions and named functions. I think the most important difference is that an anonymous function is not bound to a name, hence the name anonymous function. In JavaScript it is a first class object dynamically declared at runtime.</p>
<p>For more information on anonymous functions and lambda calculus, Wikipedia is a good start: <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anonymous_function" rel="noreferrer">Anonymous Functions</a>.</p>
<p>This is just two possible ways of declaring functions, and in the second way, you can use the function before declaration.</p>
